ai_choice.title: Apply to make change to a council flat - West Sussex - Choice
ai_choice.match: Find a planning application - West Sussex County Council
ai_choice.reason: This result deals with planning applications, which includes making changes to properties, aligning with David's need to request permission for flat improvements and understanding the process involved.

ai_page.title: Apply to make change to a council flat - West Sussex - Page
ai_page.body:
Find a planning application

Search for planning application details and decisions.

Search online for planning applications and decisions

Search the online planning applications register (external link)

We deal with planning applications for:

  • waste – for example, recycling and other waste processing sites, and sewage treatment plants
  • minerals – for example, quarries and oil/gas sites
  • the County Council's own development (known as Regulation 3) – for example, schools, libraries and fire stations.

You can see application details at County Hall, Chichester or at the relevant district or borough council office. Please phone 033 022 25777 to make an appointment.

The South Downs National Park Authority deals with all applications within the national park. All other applications are dealt with by the district or borough council.

Your data

The Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended) requires the determination of planning applications to be a transparent public process. As a planning authority, we are required to provide a publicly-available register of planning application details. For further details see our privacy notice for planning applications.

Contact us for general enquiries:

  • Email: planning.applications@westsussex.gov.uk
  • Tel: 01243 642118

Last updated: 24 June 2024

ai_feedback.title: Apply to make change to a council flat - West Sussex - Feedback

ai_issue.title: Apply to make change to a council flat - West Sussex - Issue

text_improvements.issue: The heading pertains to planning applications, but the user's need is about requesting permission for flat modifications—this mismatch may cause confusion or frustration.

text_improvements.original: Search for planning application details and decisions.
text_improvements.issue: The content emphasizes planning applications and decisions rather than simple online forms for flat improvements, which may not address the user's specific need and create unnecessary complexity.

text_improvements.original: You can see application details at County Hall, Chichester or at the relevant district or borough council office.
text_improvements.issue: This information is not relevant for users seeking a streamlined online permission process and may lead to feeling unsupported or confused about the options available.

ai_improvement.title: Apply to make change to a council flat - West Sussex - Improvement

text_issues.Issue: The heading pertains to planning applications, but the user's need is about requesting permission for flat modifications—this mismatch may cause confusion or frustration.
text_issues.improvement: Apply for permission to make changes to your flat
text_issues.why: Using a clear, action-oriented heading that directly addresses the user’s specific need makes it easier for them to find relevant information and reduces confusion.

text_issues.Issue: The content emphasizes planning applications and decisions rather than simple online forms for flat improvements, which may not address the user's specific need and create unnecessary complexity.
text_issues.original: Search for planning application details and decisions.
text_issues.improvement: Fill out a simple online form to request permission for your flat improvements.
text_issues.why: Replacing generic planning language with straightforward instructions aligns better with the user's goal, making the process seem easier and more relevant.

text_issues.Issue: This information is not relevant for users seeking a streamlined online permission process and may lead to feeling unsupported or confused about the options available.
text_issues.original: You can see application details at County Hall, Chichester or at the relevant district or borough council office.
text_issues.improvement: You can submit your online request and upload photos or plans through our dedicated flat modifications portal.
text_issues.why: Providing direct guidance on submitting online forms and uploading plans addresses the user's concern about ease and clarity, encouraging self-service and reducing confusion.
